perturbation.original_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached, and any amendments thereto may be filed without the necessity of filing additional joint filing agreements.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant and subject to Rule 13d-1(k)(1) promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the undersigned hereby agree to the joint filing of the Statement on Schedule 13D to which this Joint Filing Agreement is attached, and any amendments thereto may be filed; however, any significant amendments require individual joint filing agreements from each undersigned party.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the requirement for additional joint filing agreements. The original text states amendments can be filed without them, while the modified version implies they are required for significant amendments, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.changed_text: This Joint Filing Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, some of which may be deemed an original, and all of which may together constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that 'each' counterpart 'shall' be deemed an original. The modified text uses 'some' and 'may' which implies that not all counterparts are considered original, causing confusion on the legal weight of individual counterparts.

perturbation.original_text: The execution and filing of this agreement shall not be construed as an admission that the below-named parties are a group or have acted as a group.
perturbation.changed_text: The execution and filing of this agreement shall not necessarily be construed as an admission that the below-named parties are a group or have acted as a group. However, certain actions taken under this agreement may imply such a relationship.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the agreement should *not* be seen as an admission of group status. The changed text uses 'not necessarily,' and adds that actions may imply group status, creating a contradiction and weakening the original protection against admitting to being a group.
